<a id="SkinReference"></a>

# SkinReference

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A reference-counted holder object for a skeleton RID used in the [RenderingServer](RenderingServer.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

An internal object containing a mapping from a [Skin](Skin.md) used within the context of a particular [MeshInstance3D](MeshInstance3D.md) to refer to the skeleton's [RID](RID.md) in the RenderingServer.

See also [MeshInstance3D.get_skin_reference()](MeshInstance3D.md#MeshInstance3D_method_get_skin_reference) and [RenderingServer.instance_attach_skeleton()](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_method_instance_attach_skeleton).

Note that despite the similar naming, the skeleton RID used in the [RenderingServer](RenderingServer.md) does not have a direct one-to-one correspondence to a [Skeleton3D](Skeleton3D.md) node.

In particular, a [Skeleton3D](Skeleton3D.md) node with no [MeshInstance3D](MeshInstance3D.md) children may be unknown to the [RenderingServer](RenderingServer.md).

On the other hand, a [Skeleton3D](Skeleton3D.md) with multiple [MeshInstance3D](MeshInstance3D.md) nodes which each have different [MeshInstance3D.skin](MeshInstance3D.md#MeshInstance3D_property_skin) objects may have multiple SkinReference instances (and hence, multiple skeleton [RID](RID.md)\\ s).

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="SkinReference_method_get_skeleton"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **get_skeleton**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#SkinReference_method_get_skeleton)

Returns the [RID](RID.md) owned by this SkinReference, as returned by [RenderingServer.skeleton_create()](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_method_skeleton_create).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SkinReference_method_get_skin"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Skin](Skin.md) **get_skin**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#SkinReference_method_get_skin)

Returns the [Skin](Skin.md) connected to this SkinReference. In the case of [MeshInstance3D](MeshInstance3D.md) with no [MeshInstance3D.skin](MeshInstance3D.md#MeshInstance3D_property_skin) assigned, this will reference an internal default [Skin](Skin.md) owned by that [MeshInstance3D](MeshInstance3D.md).

Note that a single [Skin](Skin.md) may have more than one **SkinReference** in the case that it is shared by meshes across multiple [Skeleton3D](Skeleton3D.md) nodes.
